noun.description: The tuft of hairs on each seed of thistles, dandelions, and similar plants, which assists dispersal by the wind.

proper noun.description: (fl.c.AD 300–350), Greek mathematician; known as Pappus of Alexandria. His Collection of six books (another two are missing) is the principal source of knowledge of the mathematics of his predecessors.

origin: Early 18th century: via Latin from Greek pappos.
